name: treatment of electric arc furnace slag, residual material landfill | electric arc furnace slag | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23451/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'electric arc furnace slag' in a residual material landfill (RMLF). Recommended use of this dataset: for wastes-residues that are low in organic carbon (< 5 w-%) and are not biologically or chemically reactive in water. Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): H2O 5005; O 318130; H na; C 2672.7; S 1551.5; N na; P 861.86; B na; Cl na; Br na; F 20020; I na; Ag 8.4084; As 0.85185; Ba 417.42; Cd 7.6076; Co 4.8048; Cr 28228; Cu 637.64; Hg 0.04004; Mn 35135; Mo 180.18; Ni 192.19; Pb 243.24; Sb 4.004; Se 18.018; Sn 10.01; V 890.89; Zn 444.44; Be 1.1011; Sc na; Sr na; Ti 3123.1; Tl 11.011; W na; Si 83683; Fe 159160; Ca 251250; Al 37137; K 110.11; Mg 50250; Na 614.61.  Share of carbon in initial waste input that is biogenic 0%.  Additional solidification of residues with 0.4 kg of cement.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfill are released to water (short-term emissions to water from leachate and long-term emissions to ground water). Expenditures for solidificalion with cement are also included.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents a landfill site with mean annual temperature (MAT) of 9.5 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 1483.00559816076 mm/year, mean annual actual evaporation (EAT) of 528.63778611689 mm/year, and net infiltration of 954.4 mm/year. The leachate percolating through the residual material landfill has an average residence time of 3.67 years.;Reference for climatic parameters:;UN data, 2020. Precipitation, Environment Statistics Database, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?q=precipitation&d=ENV&f=variableID%3a6;;World Bank, 2022. Surface area (sq.km), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.SRF.TOTL.K2;;undata, 2020. Actual evapotranspiration, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?d=ENV&f=variableID%3a7;MeteoSwiss, 2023. Swiss federal authorities. Federal Office of Meteorology and Climatology MeteoSwiss Available at:https://www.meteoswiss.admin.ch/
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Residual material landfill for polluted, inorganic waste (VVEA Type C). With base seal and leachate collection system. Ultimate average landfill height is 10 meters. Operation phase duration is 30 years. Recultivation after closure. Additional solidification with cement requested. Based on average waste composition and climate data the end of carbonate phase in the residual material landfill is estimated to be reached after 60 000 years.
